SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.cards

Class PlayCard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.cards.Card
it.polimi.ingsw.model.cards.PlayCard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Drawable, Serializable
public class PlayCard extends Card
Represents both Gold and Resource cards. Basically, the cards that are actually playable throughout the game (The StartCard is never actually "played", the player just choose the side)
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • generateGoldCard

      public static PlayCard generateGoldCard(String cardID, String frontPath, String backPath, Corner topLeft, Corner topRight, Corner bottomLeft, Corner bottomRight, Resource resourceType, ItemCollection placementConstraint, ScoringStrategy scoringStrategy)
      Builds a new PlayCard representing a Gold card. Since Gold and Resource card share the same class, this method (alongside with the generateResourceCard method) allows to create the card and to avoid creating one with invalid data.
      Parameters:
      cardID - the card's identifier
      frontPath - path to the image that represents the front side of the card
      backPath - path to the image that represents the back side of the card
      topLeft - the top-left corner on the front side of the card.
      topRight - the top-right corner on the front side of the card.
      bottomLeft - the bottom-left corner on the front side of the card.
      bottomRight - the bottom-right corner on the front side of the card.
      resourceType - the Resource type of the card (also the permanent resource on the back).
      placementConstraint - ItemCollection representing the items the players needs to have to place the card.
      scoringStrategy - ScoringStrategy to use to evaluate the score the player is awarded upon placing the card.
      Returns:
      a new PlayCard object representing the Gold card with the specified values.

    • generateResourceCard

      public static PlayCard generateResourceCard(String cardID, String frontPath, String backPath, Corner topLeft, Corner topRight, Corner bottomLeft, Corner bottomRight, Resource resourceType, int scoreUponPlacement)
      Builds a new PlayCard representing a Resource card. Since Gold and Resource card share the same class, this method (alongside with the generateGoldCard method) allows to create the card and to avoid creating one with invalid data.
      Parameters:
      cardID - the card's identifier
      frontPath - path to the image that represents the front side of the card
      backPath - path to the image that represents the back side of the card
      topLeft - the top-left corner on the front side of the card.
      topRight - the top-right corner on the front side of the card.
      bottomLeft - the bottom-left corner on the front side of the card.
      bottomRight - the bottom-right corner on the front side of the card.
      resourceType - the Resource type of the card (also the permanent resource on the back).
      scoreUponPlacement - the score the player is awarded upon placing the card.
      Returns:
      a new PlayCard object representing the Resource card with the specified values.

    • getConstraint

      public ItemCollection getConstraint()
      Retrieves the placement constraint.
      Returns:
      a new ItemCollection that represents the constraint

    • getScoringStrategy

      public ScoringStrategy getScoringStrategy()
      Retrieves the scoring strategy.
      Returns:
      ScoringStrategy object that's used to evaluate this card's placement.

    • getType

      public Resource getType()
      Retrieves the Resource representing the type of the card.
      Returns:
      Resource representing the cards' type.

    • isGold

      public boolean isGold()
      Allows to check whether the card is a golden card.
      Returns:
      true if this is a golden card, false otherwise.

      public Resource getResourceType()
      Allows to retrieve the card type (the permanent resource on the back).
